Blythe-Rule House
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Griffin, Walter Burley (American architect and city planner, 1876-1937, active in the United States, Australia, and India) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: This house and the Page House were the first two Prairie School residences constructed in Rock Glen. James Blythe lived in this house while his residence was under construction, then sold it to his law partner, Arthur Rule. For this reason it is sometimes referred to as the Blythe-Rule House. -- http://www.prairieschooltraveler.com/html/ia/masoncity/griffin/rule.html [work]
